H0.text: communities of similar organisms found in a particular environment are called. Populations

H1.text: communities of similar organisms found in a particular environment are called. Ecosystems

H2.text: communities of similar organisms found in a particular environment are called. Biomes

H3.text: communities of similar organisms found in a particular environment are called. species

A4.text: A biome is a distinct geographical region with specific climate, vegetation, animal life, and an ecosystem.

A5.text: Formation is used when applied to plant communities only, while biome is used when concerned with both plants and animals.
